creator: calestyo@scientia.net
text:
Hi.

At http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/sections.html#file-and-web
You say:
"For example, the following configuration prevents access to any URL-path that begins in /private. In particular, it will apply to requests for http://yoursite.example.com/private, http://yoursite.example.com/private123, and http://yoursite.example.com/private/dir/file.html as well as any other requests starting with the /private string."

This seems to be not true/exact.

/private123 was not matched when I tried it, and "starting with the /private" string is thus also not axact.
It matches however with "/private/dir/file.html"

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 50375 ***
